content.description: Hand and fist crack, leaning slightly left.
content.protection: Gear to 4 camalot, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Left around the corner from Hackberry.

content.description: Wide crack. Few fist jams but more stemming and face climmbing to left or right of the crack...or hold inside of the crack. Roof 20' up the the crux. Route has much lichen on it. Can climb to the very op and use trees for anchor or travere left 10' to G&W anchors.
content.protection: big gear, nothing smaller than a #2. Helps to have a few 3, 4s, even 5...could have placed a 6.
content.location: The obvious wide crack in the middle of the wall. Route directly to the right of Gimp and Wheezer. Has a tree growing our of wall 10' off the ground.

content.description: Technical slab climb with obvious crux.
content.protection: 5 bolts and 2 sport anchors.

content.description: Some great slab climbing. The first forty feet hold the most difficult climbing. Great clipping stances and fun moves between each bolt. There is still some lichen on the rock.
content.protection: Nine bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The farthest left hand route on the Walls of Moria. There is a sign right by the route. It also can be found by following the trail uphill right after you pass the Idaho boulders.

content.description: A sustained bolted climb with good holds. Up the arete then step left at the obvious small roof and finish up the left hand face.
content.protection: 7 bolts and anchor
content.location: Sits to the far right side of the Gimp and Wheezer Wall. Starts off a ledge right of an obvious chimney.

content.description: This undulating chimney starts wide and quickly narrows before you gain a rest ledge. Another wider section is followed by the cruxy wide offwidth/squeeze chimney.
content.protection: Gear up to a BD 6. One bolt at the top, otherwise tree anchor.
content.location: This route is the obvious chimney in the middle of the Black Slabs to the left of The Seamstress.

content.description: A very fun slab route. The route follows a small seam that rarely produces good holds. However, there is plenty of adaquate holds and good feet. Seems harder than many of the 10a's at the ranch.
content.protection: Five bolts and a two bolt anchor. A sling can be brought for the stump near the top.
content.location: On the right hand side of Confederate Cracks area. It is to the right Hackberry Crack. You can see the large roof of Nova Monkey from the route, and it sits just to the right of a large chimney called Shelob's Lair. Look for the shallow seam and two sawed off stumps near the top.

content.description: Crux is between bolt 3-4...on arete. Just commit.
content.protection: Just QDs
content.location: First sport route to the left of crack in my back

climbs.name: Message to a Hairy Man Back

content.description: Tricky start leads to good climbing. Crux is pulling over the bulge midway up the route. Start can be bypassed by starting off to the left.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolted anchor
content.location: This route is on the Man Back Boulder around the corner from T-Slab.

content.description: 5.8 route, starts on ledge, into a 15' crack system...then big chickenheads to the top there are mussy hook anchors up top. Its only 5.8 if you stay in crack...if you climb the jugs to the left...it is 5.5 but less gear.
content.protection: Few pieces and then sling the chickenheads on upper wall. There are anchors.
content.location: To the left of the 5.9 sport route

content.description: Tiny knobs and slopers abound on this steep slab.  Stay right between the last bolt and the anchors on a blunt arete.
content.protection: 7 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Near right end of Confederate Cracks, on the left end of the Black Slabs area.

climbs.name: In The Crack Or On Your Back

content.description:
I can't believe this route isn't on Mountain Project! This is a major classic! 

  The route begins in an easy dihedral with lots of stemming options. After about 20 feet the walls smooth out to form a perfectly blank corner split by a 4-5 inch crack. No faking it. Off width technique is mandatory. Near the top, the crack widens up and you can wiggle inside a pod and cop a rest before continuing to the chains.
content.protection: I placed one #2, one #4 and two #5 Camelots, and a #4 Helium Friend. You could probably find a #3 Camelot down low. You can place a #6 as well, though I'm not sure it's worth hauling up. This route is equipped with a bolted anchor.
content.location: A few minutes walk to the right (north) of Hackberry Crack. Walk the trail past the black slabs and past the obvious chimney of GV. Look for the striking wide crack in prefect gray rock.

content.description: Excellent Hands splitter.  Pass a flared section about 15' up, then jam through the crux bulge.  Great jams from bottom to top.  Only complaint is that it's not longer.
content.protection: Doubles of #0.75 to #3. There is a spot for a #4 if you have it. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right above the Idaho boulders.  Very obvious splitter as seen from the trail--can't miss it.  Treebeard is the 5.8 crack around the corner an uphill to the left.

content.description: Flared chimney diminishing at small roof.  Move left and face climb to anchors.
content.protection: Gear to 3 inches, mostly small stuff if I remember right.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Very right end of the Confederate Cracks.  Starts in sunken area, left of Nova Monkey roof.

content.description: Start up a black streak pulling a mantle then continuing up enjoyable climbing similar to the routes on the Walls of Moria proper. You will probably find some lichen at the top.
content.protection: Bolts, bolted anchors
content.location: The first sport route left of the waterfall cave

content.description: The best part is right off the ground, a finger crack in a dihedral, with full on laybacking and smearing for 10 feet.  A couple stemming moves to a ledge.  Then, the crack gets wider and easier to the bolts.
content.protection: Gear to 4 camalot, 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Start on small crimps and pockets on a vertical face. The top consists of some of the great slab climbing that the area is known for.
content.protection: Eleven bolts and a two bolt anchor. Shares anchor with Stove Top.
content.location: On the left hand side of the Walls of Moria. Right behind the sign. It is the second route from the left hand side of the wall.

content.description: The early crux leads to a technical slab.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right side of the cave feature just up the hill from the Moondye Boulder. Right side of the "Walls of Moria".

content.description: Climb the seam with laybacks.
content.protection: 4 bolts

content.description: Great climbing from bottom to top. Interesting pocketed climbing leads to a large flake and then some good slab climbing to finish. This climb is also very well protected.
content.protection: Eleven bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Located on the Walls of Moria. It is the third bolted line from the left hand side. The Walls of Moria is just past the Idaho Boulders if you are walking from the cabins. Look for black streaked walls with lichen. The walls are much longer than they look from the ground. There is a sign.

content.description:
The collection of routes just past Confederat Cracks, which hosts lower angle climbs with sloping holds and water runnels formed between routes.  

  Stays wet when it recieves rain.
